meanings.definition: The perception or awareness of the position and movement of the body.
meanings.sent1: Her proprioception helped her walk in the dark without bumping into things.
meanings.sent2: Athletes rely on proprioception to maintain balance and coordination during intense physical activities.
meanings.sent3: The robot's advanced proprioception made it a great dancer at the party.
meanings.sent4: His proprioception was so acute, it was as if he had eyes in the back of his head.
meanings.sent5: Improving proprioception can enhance overall body control and prevent injuries.

meanings.definition: The sense of the relative position of neighboring parts of the body and strength of effort being employed in movement.
meanings.sent1: Children develop proprioception as they learn to crawl and walk.
meanings.sent2: Yoga helps improve proprioception by focusing on body awareness and alignment.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's enhanced proprioception allowed him to always catch falling objects effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: In the dance competition, her proprioception was like a finely tuned instrument, guiding every graceful move.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's impeccable proprioception mesmerized the audience with her flawless performance.
